line_1: His Soul was gentle as a Lamb;
line_2: He grew in Favour both with Man,

line_1: Stray'd from the fold, a sportive lamb
line_2: Skipp'd wanton, by her fleecy dam;

line_1: Now the full Glories of the Lamb
line_2: And the Young Cherubs learn his Name,

line_1: To bless his utmost Hopes, a snowy Lamb;
line_2: This his whole Stock, till in full time there came,

line_1: I meet a strolling kid, or bleating lamb,
line_2: And not a little chide its thoughtless dam.

line_1: Those were to feed and watch the tender Lamb,
line_2: And seek fresh Pasture for its bleating Dam,

line_1: Then came his Brother with a trembling Lamb;
line_2: Astonish'd stood the late presumptuous Man,

line_1: Yea Thou true Witness, spotless Lamb,
line_2: My sole Desire, my constant Aim,

line_1: THUS, when a prowling Wolf has stol'n a Lamb,
line_2: He sternly guards it from the bleating Dam;
Sweetly Sure of Grace I am,

line_1: Through some lone Desart roves a stragg'ling Lamb;
line_2: So lost from Shepherd and its mourning Dam,

line_1: Or seems to bleat, a Vegetable Lamb.
line_2: Eyes with mute tenderness her distant dam,

line_1: Some chickens and a chine of lamb —
line_2: Powell, d'ye hear, let's have the ham,

line_1: T' attend the Marriage of the Lamb,
line_2: Yet higher still our farthest Aim;

line_1: That Ridge is anchovy, and Reynolds is lamb;
line_2: To make out the dinner, full certain I am,
